abstract: NHL Roundup; Nashville Predators defenseman Shea Weber wins hardest shot at NHL All-Star skills competition; other hockey news noted.
lead_paragraph: Nashville’s Shea Weber fired the hardest shot with a 108.5-mile-per-hour blast at the N.H.L. All-Star skills competition, a shot second only to the 108.8-m.p.h. drive in 2012 by the five-time winner Zdeno Chara.
snippet: Nashville’s Shea Weber fired the hardest shot with a 108.5-mile-per-hour blast at the N.H.L. All-Star skills competition, a shot second only to the 108.8-m.p.h. drive in 2012 by the five-time winner Zdeno Chara.

headline.main: All-Stars, and One 7-Year-Old Fan, Show Off Their Skills on the Ice
headline.print_headline: All-Stars, and One 7-Year-Old Fan, Show Off Their Skills on the Ice
